headline.main: CITY INTELLIGENCE.; The Elm-street Sufferers. SYMPATHY MEETING IN THE CENTRAL PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH. FOG ON THE BAY AND RIVERS. PROPOSED REMOVAL OF THE DOWN-TOWN STEAMBOAT LANDINGS. LECTURE BY HON. JOHN A. DIX. THE NEW-YORK, HORTICULTURAL SOCIETY. FOR CALIFORNIA. THE PROPOSED STATUE OF COMMODORE PERRY AT CENTRAL PARK. CATHOLIC LIBRARY ASSOCIATION. FIRE IN TROY-STREET. PERSONAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: An public meeting in behalf of the sufferers by the late fire in Elm-street was held last evening in the Central Presbyterian Church, in Broome-street. Mr. S.L. MACOMBEE called the meeting to order, and nominated as Chairman Hon. Judge ULSHOEFFER. The nomination having been ratified, Mr. MACOMBER was appointed Secretary.

headline.main: SWILL MILK.; A Vindication of Dr. Percy's Report to the Academy of Medicine.

headline.main: UNION MEETING IN PHILADELPHIA.; Letters of Hon. Edward Everett, Hon. Millard Fillmore and Hon. John J. Crittenden.

docs.lead_paragraph: A "Constitutional Union Movement" was inaguurated last Saturday evening in National Hall, in Philadelphia, by a very large public meeting. In consequence of the absence of all the notable speakers whose attendance had been either promised or expected, the interest of the proceedings mainly centres in the letters read. The meeting was called for 7 o'clock.
